discussion.content:
"Flow exporters export the data in the flow monitor cache to a remote system, such as a server running NetFlow collector, for analysis and storage. "

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/fnetflow/configuration/15-mt/fnf-15-mt-book/fnf-fnetflow.html
But it seems to be ROUTE question.

"An object track list allows you to track the combined states of multiple objects. Object track lists support the following capabilities:

Boolean "and" function—Each object defined within the track list must be in an up state so that the track list object can become up.
Boolean "or" function—At least one object defined within the track list must be in an up state so that the tracked object can become up.
Threshold percentage—The percentage of up objects in the tracked list must be greater than the configured up threshold for the tracked list to be in the up state. If the percentage of down objects in the tracked list is above the configured track list down threshold, the tracked list is marked as down.
Threshold weight—Assign a weight value to each object in the tracked list, and a weight threshold for the track list. If the combined weights of all up objects exceeds the track list weight up threshold, the track list is in an up state. If the combined weights of all the down objects exceeds the track list weight down threshold, the track list is in the down state."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus5500/sw/unicast/6_x/cisco_n5500_layer3_ucast_cfg_rel_6x/l3_object.html#82611

discussion.content: Nonetheless, the term "encapsulation" is in use regarding 802.1Q
Unlike ISL, 802.1Q does not encapsulate the original Ethernet frame

questions.question_text: 802.1Q trunking, what does it do? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
"If you configure more than eight links for an EtherChannel group, the software automatically decides which of the hot-standby ports to make active based on the LACP priority. To every link between systems that operate LACP, the software assigns a unique priority made up of these elements (in priority order):

LACP system priority
System ID (the switch MAC address)
LACP port priority
Port number"

Citation from reference link by aadeeb

questions.question_text: Which four LACP components are used to determine which hot-standby links become active after an interface failure within an EtherChannel bundle? (Choose four.)

discussion.content: Why not A? Why should we to configure the same revision number???

comments.content: I figured out my mistake: they mean a MST revision number but not a VTP configuration revision number. The correct answer is D.

choices.B: DSW2 uses the VTP server mode to automatically propagate the MST configuration to DSW1.
choices.E: DSW1 is in VTP client mode with a lower configuration revision number, therefore, it automatically inherits MST configuration from DW2.
choices.D: Configure DSW1 with the same region name, revision number, and VLAN-to-instance mapping as shown on DSW2.
choices.A: Configure DSW1 with the same version number, and VLAN-to-instance mapping as shown on DSW2.
choices.C: DSW1 automatically inherits MST configuration from DSW2 because they have the same domain name.
